title: contemporary serif w/ nice italics
content:
Hey yo,  
I’m looking for some contemporary serif typefaces with interesting italics to be used for pullquotes and headers in a women’s magazine.

The sort of thing I’m looking for:  
 [Oxtail](http://web.archive.org/web/20080101190021/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_oxtail.html)  
 [Remontoire](http://web.archive.org/web/20080101190021/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_remon.html)  
(straight from typophile’s very own Stefan Hattenbach!)

Faces like [Kursivschrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20080101190021/http:/www.paratype.com/fstore/default.asp?fcode=248&search=Kursivschrift) are right up the same alley as well, if not perhaps a bit overused.

Any thoughts you guys might have on this would be greatly appreciated.

 [‹ a serif that works with Corporate S?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080101190021/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14947 "Go to previous forum topic") [Please help with information on Massimo Vignelli ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080101190021/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14904 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pierattt
